comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Apparently not in Margate, but in neighboring Broadstairs: "Kingsgate Castle on the cliffs above Kingsgate Bay, Broadstairs, Kent, was built for Lord Holland (Henry Fox, 1st Baron Holland) in the 1760s. The name Kingsgate is related to an incidental landing of Charles II on 30 June 1683 (‘gate’ referring to a cliff-gap) though other English monarchs have also used this cove, such as George II in 1748. The building was later the residence of John Lubbock, 1st Baron Avebury. The building has now been converted into 31 flats." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingsgate_Castle July, 2012 Street View: maps.google.com/maps?q=broadstairs+england,kingsgate+cast... More: "2. circa 1760 Lord Holland built a copy of a Welsh Edwardian castle to house his stables. This soon fell into ruin and the large round tower is all that remains of the original building. In the late C19 it was rebuilt by Lord Avebury. Quadrangular in shape. 2 to 3 storeys flint faced with stone long and short quoins and window dressings. Crenellated parapet. Windows are 3 light mullions." www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/en-417608-kingsgate-cast...
